content:
I think I'll try cleaning the aerator and checking the P-trap to see if that makes a difference. I've never really cleaned the aerator before, so that might be the culprit. And I'll make sure the P-trap is properly filled with water.

I'm also going to take your advice and tackle the trash can smell. I've been meaning to clean it out for a while now, and it's definitely due for a good scrubbing. Maybe that will help reduce the overall odor in the bathroom.

I'm still a bit concerned that there might be a more serious issue with the drain line, but I'll try these steps first before calling a plumber. Fingers crossed that it's just a simple fix!

Do you think I should use a specific type of cleaner or product to clean the aerator and P-trap, or just hot water and soap? And are there any specific odor-absorbing products you'd recommend for the trash can?
